intro: Coussarea hondensis, commonly known as Honduran coussarea, is a tropical shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and produces small, fragrant flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in lowland tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
